instruction_text:
To resolve Teams authentication issues:

1. Check credentials:
   - Verify username and password are correct
   - Try logging in through web browser first (teams.microsoft.com)
   - Check if account requires MFA (Multi-Factor Authentication)

2. Clear Teams cache:
   - Close Teams completely
   - Delete cache: %appdata%\Microsoft\Teams
   - Delete: %localappdata%\Microsoft\Teams
   - Restart Teams

3. Check Office 365 account status:
   - Verify account is active and not locked
   - Check if password has expired
   - Verify license is assigned in Office 365 admin

4. Reset Teams credentials:
   - Windows: Credential Manager > Windows Credentials
   - Remove all Microsoft Teams entries
   - Restart Teams and sign in again

5. Check network/firewall:
   - Verify Teams URLs are not blocked
   - Check firewall allows Teams traffic
   - Test connectivity: https://teams.microsoft.com

6. Update Teams:
   - Click profile icon > Check for updates
   - Or download latest from teams.microsoft.com
   - Uninstall and reinstall if needed

7. Run Teams as administrator:
   - Right-click Teams > Run as administrator
   - Test if sign-in works with elevated privileges

8. Check for proxy issues:
   - File > Settings > Network
   - Configure proxy settings if needed
   - Test direct connection vs proxy

9. Verify SSO configuration:
   - Check if SSO (Single Sign-On) is configured
   - Verify Azure AD connection
   - Check conditional access policies

10. Contact IT Admin if:
    - Account shows as not licensed
    - Organization policies prevent sign-in
    - Domain authentication issues
